abstract: Callvine, a startup run by eFax’s founder and former chief executive, Rudy Prince, announced Monday that it has raised $4 million for its group calling and texting iPhone app, according to VentureBeat.
snippet: Callvine, a startup run by eFax’s founder and former chief executive, Rudy Prince, announced Monday that it has raised $4 million for its group calling and texting iPhone app, according to VentureBeat.
lead_paragraph: Callvine, a start-up run by eFax’s founder and former chief executive, Rudy Prince, announced Monday that it has raised $4 million for its group calling and texting iPhone app, according to VentureBeat.

headline.main: Callvine Raises $4 Million for Group Calling
